page.title: 11Roborough Down (1).
page.content: Roborough Down is a small part of the 365 sq.miles that is the Dartmoor National Park.A Dartmoor ranger,an R.S.P.C.A. inspector and 'Roborough Commoners' meet once amonth to dicuss the use of the Down. It is an enclosed common of some 2000 acres covered with gorse, bracken, heather and grass. It is grazed by ponies and sheep but by very few cattle. They all help to maintain the land, providing natural fertiliser and keeping herbage down. During the winter farmers provide fodder for cattle from which the other animals will also benefit. Due to the decline in the number of cattle the ponies have also declined. All animals are owned by six farmers whose farms border the common and who thus have 'Commoners Rights' to graze animals on the common that is Roborough Down.
